intro: Duosperma tanzaniense, commonly known as the Tanzanian double-seed plant, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-seeded fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually succulent, which helps it retain water in dry climates. The flowers are small and yellow, often clustered in dense inflorescences.
